title: Oilers unravel as 'penalty chaos' reigns in Game 3
content: In a blowout Game 3 loss, the Oilers took 21 penalties for 85 penalty minutes, pulled their starting goaltender, had a near line-brawl, and one of their players was irritated enough to squirt a stream from his water bottle at the Florida bench.

content: Although social media abuse of athletes dropped during March Madness, a study showed Tuesday, harassment of tournament officials and coaches spiked.

content: Bengals star DE Trey Hendrickson will not report for mandatory minicamp, which starts Tuesday, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, as Hendrickson seeks a long-term deal.

title: Pulisic likes dad's response to Donovan criticism

title: From Kick-Six to the Lamar Leap: The top 25 college football plays of the millennium

content: These teams got the best players from the transfer portal -- with some familiar faces in the mix for top spot.

title: India‚Äôs population reaches 146.39 crore, fertility rate drops below replacement level: UN report
content: The population is expected to grow to 170 crore before starting to dip in about 40 years, the report titled ‚ÄúState of the World Population 2025: The Real Fertility Crisis‚Äù says.

content: In the past, the examination has been plagued by malpractices and arbitrariness, forcing many to either pay hefty bribes or take the exam overseas

content: They were part of a group based in Qatar and were on a holiday when the bus in which they were travelling met with an accident on Ol Jororok-Nakuru Road in Nyandarua County

title: NMC yet to give permission for enhancement of medical seats; medical seat matrix delayed
content: The DME had submitted a proposal to the NMC in March 2025 for the enhancement of a total of 800 MBBS and 700 PG medical seats for the state. However, even after three months of submitting the request, permission has not been granted for the seat enhancement.

title: App-based gig platform exclusively for women launched ¬†¬†

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) open to alliance with MNS for Maharashtra‚Äôs benefit, says Sanjay Raut
content: There is no political ego in it, says the Rajya Sabha MP, as speculation grows about a reconciliation between Uddhav and Raj Thackeray

title: Deal sternly, quickly with crimes against women, ganja gangs, CM tells police

title: LDF, UDF pull out all the stops in bypoll campaign in Nilambur
content: LDF is going all out for its candidate M. Swaraj. As many as 10 Ministers campaigned for him on Tuesday.  Campaign for UDF candidate Aryadan Shoukath is gaining momentum with top leaders leading the charge

title: TNCC completes constitution of 70% of village committees, says  Selvaperunthagai
content: We are now establishing booth committees, which are the heart of the party, says the TNCC president, who met party national president Mallikarjun Kharge and general secretary K. C. Venugopal in New Delhi on Monday

title: Burning cargo vessel along Kerala coast has flammable solids, liquids
content: According to the cargo manifest, there are 157 containers with hazardous substances on the ship. They are flammable liquids, solids, spontaneously combustible solids, and substances either in liquid or solid form that can damage human health

title: National Security Guard defused two drones laden with explosives at Jammu airport after Operation Sindoor: NSG Director General
content: The NSG has been deployed for the first time in a Left Wing Extremism-affected area in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra, amid the Union government‚Äôs aim to end Maoism by March 2026

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin launches Chennai Book Park in Central Metro station
content: The facility, set up at a cost of ‚Çπ1.85 crore, has a collection of 15,000 books published by the Tamil Nadu Textbook and Educational Services Corporation and others. Based on the reception, others book parks will be opened at places such as the Alandur Metro station, says official

title: In shipwreck, best practice is to register case against ship owner, says ex-Shipping Secretary
content: He says the case can be pursued both legally and through negotiations, citing an incident involving MSC in Maharashtra

title: PM Modi meets members of all-party delegations
content: During the meeting at 7, Lok Kalyan Marg, delegation members talked about their meetings in different nations.

title: At least five Qatar-based Indian nationals die in road accident in Kenya
content: The identity of the dead is yet to be verified, while 27 are injured and admitted to various hospitals in Kenya

title: Spike in leptospirosis cases worries Health department in Kerala
content: In 2022, the State recorded 5,315 probable and confirmed cases of leptospirosis and 290 deaths (both probable and confirmed). The very next year, 5,186 cases and 282 deaths were recorded. In 2024, the number of cases jumped to 5,980 and the deaths to  394. This year too, the picture looks quite alarming, with 1,451 cases and 74 deaths recorded till June 9.

title: Farmers pay tributes to those killed in 2008 Haveri police firing
content: They stage a demonstration at Hosamani Siddappa Circle in Haveri blocking the road for some time and raising various other demands

title: West Bengal Assembly unanimously passes resolution lauding armed forces
content: Mamata Banerjee says that during the conflict ‚Äúthere was an opportunity to capture Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir‚Äù;  Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari asks why reference to ‚ÄúOperation Sindoor‚Äù was absent in the Assembly resolution

title: New Osmania General Hospital scheduled to be ready in 30 months at estimated cost of ‚Çπ1,667 crore
content: The main hospital structure will rise to 12 floors, including two basement levels for parking, covering a total built-up area of 23.42 lakh square feet

title: Re-enumeration of castes: A setback for Siddaramaiah
content: The Chief Minister has been justifying the caste census report, insisting that it was scientifically done and that it would help assess the social, economic, and educational conditions of various communities

title: Young horticulture graduates told to update their skills
content: As many as 95 gold medals awarded to 35 students at 14th convocation of University of Horticultural Sciences in Bagalkot

title: Reduce fertilizer use to preserve soil health, says Naidu
content: CM directs officials to ensure that 35 lakh metric tons of fertilizer is used in the kharif season this year against 39 lakh metric tons used in the season last year

content: The BJP MP says the multi-party delegation he led to multiple European countries gave historical context to India‚Äôs Operation Sindoor

content: Headmaster‚Äôs inattention had resulted in the participation of a POCSO case accused in the school Praveshanolsavam last week

title: TTD to conduct ‚ÄòSadgamaya‚Äô from June 16 to inculcate values among schoolchildren
content: Executive Officer J. Shyamala Rao says classes will be conducted for the seventh, eighth and ninth grade students of the various schools run by the TTD in Tirupati and Tirumala

title: Andhra Pradesh government will release a notification soon to fill 8,000 doctor posts, says Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav inaugurates Block Public Health Unit and a tehsildar office at Tadimarri in Sri Sathya Sai district

title: Internship Kerala 1.0 to connect 1 lakh FYUGP students with internship opportunities
content: The platform, envisaged to cater to 1 lakh students, is expected to offer a diverse range of opportunities, categorised into free internships, internships with a stipend and paid internships.

title: Arambai Tenggol lifts shutdown in Manipur, seeks its leader‚Äôs release
content: Armed Meitei group said it heeded public appeals to end the shutdown; Imphal Valley returning to normalcy on Tuesday after clashes between protestors and security personnel on Monday night

title: Task Force on child rights told to meet compulsorily once in three months
content: The Child Rights Protection Task Force, headed by tahsildars, has been asked to take necessary preventive steps for child rights protection

title: Caste census will benefit NDA, delimitation is a Constitutional right: Kushwaha
content: NDA ally says Centre will get credit for caste census, noting that Congress and its allies never conducted it when in power; opposes southern CMs calling for population increases due to upcoming delimitation

title: Nominations of Kamal Haasan, DMK and AIADMK candidates from T.N. declared valid for Rajya Sabha election
content: If there are no withdrawals of candidates till 3 p.m. on June 12, the six candidates would be declared winners.

title: Stalin flags ‚Äúhigh‚Äù interest rates for development loans, hopes for World Bank support
content: Interest rates range between 6% and 7%,¬†says the Chief Minister; he adds that he expects World Bank to back investments that fulfil the socio-economic requirements of the people by providing loans

title: US Envoy Says He Does Not Think Palestinian State Is US Policy Goal: Report
content: US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee said he did not think that an independent Palestinian state remains a goal of US foreign policy, according to an interview with Bloomberg News released on Tuesday.

title: "Proud Of Manner In Which...": PM Modi Meets Members Of All-Party Delegations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday evening met members of multi-party delegations who had travelled to world capitals to convey India's strong stand against Pakistan-linked terrorism following Operation Sindoor.

title: Pak Man Stabs Wife To Death In Flat Near Mumbai Before Killing Self
content: A 45-year-old Pakistani national allegedly fatally stabbed his 35-year-old wife, also a Pakistani, using a kitchen knife in their rented flat in Kharghar node of Navi Mumbai before killing himself over a domestic dispute, police said on Tuesday.

title: Class 4 Grudge, Escalation 50 Years Later: 2 Seniors Beat Up Another In Kerala
content: Nursing a grudge from a school fight 52 years ago, two elderly men beat up their old classmate, now 62 years old, in Kerala's Kasaragod on Monday, said the police.

title: EU Removes UAE From 'High-Risk' Money-Laundering List
content: The EU on Tuesday announced the removal of the United Arab Emirates from its money-laundering "high-risk" list but added Monaco alongside nine other jurisdictions.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi To Reach Meghalaya Tonight, Video From Flight Emerges
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, the wife of Raja Raghuvanshi and his alleged killer, is being taken from Uttar Pradesh to Meghalaya today for further investigations by the state police. She is currently in Kolkata and is expected to reach Shillong by midnight.

title: As Mass Shooting In Austria Kills 10, A Look At Europe's History Of Gun Violence
content: A gunman killed ten people at a secondary school in the southern Austrian city of Graz on Tuesday, in the worst school shooting in the country's modern history. At least 10 others were injured in the school massacre.

title: Hives To Be Removed From Ajanta Cave Complex After Bees Attack Tourists
content: Following incidents of honey-bee attacks on tourists, the forest department has started the process of removing 13 hives from four caves at the world-famous Ajanta Cave complex, an official told PTI here on Tuesday.

title: "Tarred And Feathered": US Speaker Calls For California Governor's Torture
content: To put an end to the protests, about 700 Marines have been deployed in Los Angeles and 4,000 National Guard troops have been mobilised. The American military does not have any domestic law enforcement role.

title: Iran Executes 9 People Arrested Over Planned Islamic State Attack
content: Iran executed nine people it said were members of the Islamic State, state media reported on Tuesday, after their arrest in early 2018 during clashes in which three members of the Revolutionary Guards were killed.

title: Israel Launches Large-Scale Military Operation In West Bank City Of Nablus
content: Israel launched a large-scale military operation on Tuesday in the old city of Nablus in the occupied West Bank, AFP journalists reported, with the army reporting injured troops and two Palestinians "eliminated".

title: Congress Has Asked For New Caste Survey In Karnataka: DK Shivakumar
content: The Congress central leadership has ordered that a new caste survey be held in in Karnataka, said the party's senior leader and the state's Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar today.

title: India's Population To Reach 1.46 Billion This Year: UN Report
content: India's population is estimated to reach 1.46 billion in 2025, continuing to be the highest in the world, according to a new UN demographic report, which also revealed the country's total fertility rate has fallen below the replacement rate.

title: Weather, Rocket Issues May Further Delay India's Cosmic Leap
content: All eyes will be in the sky tomorrow as the rocket carrying Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, and a billion Indian hopes, lifts off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Wednesday. Group Captain Shukla will be only the second Indian in space.

title: 'Letting Children Go So Far...': Mohan Yadav On Lesson From Meghalaya Murder
content: Expressing grief over the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi, which was allegedly plotted by his wife Sonam, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav also said parents should think whether they should let their children go so far.

title: Prayers Offered In Lucknow For Success Of Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom-4 Mission
content: Special prayers were offered in Lucknow on Tuesday for the success of the thrice-postponed lift-off of Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, on board SpaceX's Falcon-9 rocket.

title: BJP vs Trinamool After Bengal Assembly Avoids 'Op Sindoor' In Resolution
content: The West Bengal Assembly on Tuesday unanimously adopted a resolution commending the Indian armed forces for their precision strikes on terror hubs across the western border, even as the proceedings were marred by a stormy political

title: Trainer Plane Makes Emergency Landing At Madhya Pradesh Airport, Pilots Safe
content: A trainer plane belonging to a private flying academy made an emergency landing at Khajuraho airport on Tuesday after its right rear wheel (landing gear) didn't open, an official said.

title: Uber To Launch Self-Driving Taxis In London Next Year
content: Ride-hailing firm Uber will launch self-driving taxis in London next year when England trials new driverless services, the firm and the UK government said on Tuesday.

title: "Like Cat Guarding Milk": India Criticises UN Over Pak's Anti-Terror Panel Role
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said today that in recent years, many decisions of the United Nations have been questioned.

title: 'It‚Äôs Civil War': Marines in LA, lies flood socials - Is US democracy the target?
content: Los Angeles is gripped by protests following immigration raids and the deployment of federal troops, escalating tensions both on the streets and online. Disinformation campaigns are fueling the unrest, with doctored photos and conspiracy theories spreading rapidly across social media.

title: From Indore to Meghalaya to UP - and back to Meghalaya: Sonam's journey to crime scene
content: A honeymoon in Meghalaya turned tragic as Sonam Raghuvanshi is accused of orchestrating her husband Raja's murder. She allegedly conspired with her lover, Raj Kushwaha, and hired contract killers. Sonam surrendered in Uttar Pradesh, and is now being transported back to Meghalaya along with four other suspects to reconstruct the crime.

title: Los Angeles riots: City of Angels turns into downtown of rioters
content: Amidst growing protests against immigration raids, President Trump deployed federal forces to Los Angeles, raising concerns about authoritarian overreach. California officials condemned the move as a provocation, while incidents of violence and the treatment of journalists sparked international criticism. The crackdown on undocumented workers, targeting specific locations, has ignited fear and outrage within immigrant communities and drawn sharp political divisions.

title: Faith in flux: Why Islam is growing faster than Christianity; Hinduism holds steady
content: A recent Pew Research Center report reveals that while most major religious groups expanded between 2010 and 2020, Christianity's global share declined due to religious switching, despite a population increase. Islam experienced the fastest growth, driven by demographics and higher fertility rates. The religiously unaffiliated saw a significant rise, largely due to individuals leaving Christianity.

title: Meghalaya murder case: Accused gets slapped at Indore airport by unknown man
content: The Meghalaya murder case has sparked national outrage after an Indore businessman was allegedly killed during his honeymoon. His wife, Sonam, is implicated, with evidence suggesting her involvement. As the accused were being transported, an unidentified man slapped one of them at Indore airport, highlighting the intense public sentiment surrounding the crime.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There‚Äôs a new programming language. It is called‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: 'Unlike BJP or Left': Rahul asks K'taka govt to take responsibility for Bengaluru stampede
content: Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge have voiced their disapproval of the Karnataka government's involvement in RCB's IPL victory celebrations. They emphasized the importance of human lives and urged the government to be more responsive, contrasting it with the perceived inaction of BJP and Left governments in similar tragedies.

title: Missiles, fighter jets: Why China‚Äôs control on rare earth is giving US a headache
content: China's dominance in rare earth minerals, particularly samarium, poses a significant challenge to the US and its allies in replenishing military equipment. Export restrictions on these materials, vital for defence applications, are impacting weapon production. Despite ongoing trade negotiations, China is unlikely to ease these restrictions.

title: India's anti-terror outreach: PM Modi meets all-party delegation members
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with all-party delegation members. They shared experiences from diplomatic missions. These missions communicated India's firm stance against Pakistan-linked terrorism. This followed Operation Sindoor. Delegations visited 33 international capitals. S Jaishankar praised their role. The teams included both ruling and opposition party leaders. This initiative showcased national unity against terrorism. Key leaders from various parties participated.

title: Buying an iPhone in Dubai vs buying an iPhone in India? The major pros and cons
content: For Indian Apple enthusiasts, purchasing the iPhone 16 in Dubai presents a mixed bag. While Pro models offer potential cost savings, non-Pro versions might be pricier. Buying in Dubai means missing out on Indian bank offers and exchange discounts. FaceTime restrictions and potential import duties also need consideration, impacting the overall value proposition.

title: 'We want to give them a send-off': Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma possibly playing their final series
content: Indian cricket icons Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to feature in Australia's upcoming ODI series, potentially their last on Australian soil, according to Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg. He highlighted a packed summer schedule, including matches in every Australian capital.

title: Austria school shooting: Assailant used two weapons; what we know about attacker
content: A devastating shooting at a high school in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of ten people, including seven students and the suspected attacker. The incident prompted a swift response from special forces and the evacuation of the school. Authorities believe the student assailant acted alone and likely took his own life after opening fire, leaving several others seriously injured.

title: 'Until we got married': Kansas City Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes opens up about wife
content: Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback Patrick Mahomes recently lauded his wife, Brittany, for her unwavering support since their high school days. He credited her for helping him evolve, both on and off the field. Mahomes highlighted Brittany's constant presence and influence, acknowledging her pivotal role in his personal and professional growth.

title: Steve Jobs told Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay married to .., skill he says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: Australia or South Africa? WTC Final winner predicted
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts South Africa will triumph over Australia in the World Test Championship final. Lobo's analysis, based on planetary positions and player horoscopes, suggests Australia's past successes have diminished their 'karmic quota.

title: Fresh caste survey in Karnataka; CM Siddaramaiah sets 90-day deadline
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced a fresh caste survey following concerns from various stakeholders regarding the 2015-16 report. The Congress high command advised considering all perspectives on the survey. The new enumeration aims to address apprehensions and will be completed within 90 days, potentially impacting reservation policies for Backward Communities.

title: String of explosions: Three killed after 16 bombs detonate in Colombia
content: Southwest Colombia experienced a series of coordinated attacks on Tuesday, resulting in three fatalities. Four car bombs and three additional explosive devices detonated across Cali, Corinto, El Bordo, and Jamundi. The explosions targeted police stations and municipal buildings, causing significant damage, including gutted buildings and wrecked storefronts. No group has claimed responsibility, but guerrillas are known to operate in the region.

title: Murder in hills of Meghalaya: The masterminds and three accused
content: A honeymoon trip turned deadly in Meghalaya as Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered. His newlywed wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, are accused of orchestrating the crime. Police have arrested five individuals, including Sonam and Raj, in connection with the murder, revealing a shocking conspiracy and a multi-state manhunt.

title: LA riots: Masked looters ransack Apple store, flee with merchandise - Video
content: Los Angeles is facing unrest as protests intensify against President Trump's immigration raids, leading to looting, including an Apple store incident. Trump has deployed National Guard troops and is escalating military presence, a move opposed by local officials and Governor Newsom. The protests were triggered by increased federal immigration enforcement, resulting in arrests and escalating tensions between the federal government and California leadership.

title: Gold vs Silver: Why silver may outperform gold; record-breaking rally likely
content: Silver prices have surged, hitting a 13-year high, fueled by a weakening dollar. Technical indicators suggest a potential breakout, with historical data showing strong returns after reaching new highs.

title: Bengals star Trey Hendrickson gets support from VP Vance amid contract buzz
content: Cincinnati Bengals' Trey Hendrickson's contract situation gains attention as Vice President JD Vance publicly supports him, calling him a 'generational talent.' Vance's endorsement highlights Hendrickson's value to the team, given his consistent performance with 17.5 sacks in each of the last two seasons. The Bengals face pressure to extend Hendrickson's contract, balancing financial management with retaining a key player.

title: When Nietzsche met God in the tunnels of Gaza
content: Omer had never been strictly religious. Like many secular Israelis, faith was a distant concept. He had completed his military service and was waiting tables to save for a post-army trip to South America. Yet, within days of his abduction, he began talking to God, making promises, and blessing the scraps of food he was given. It was faith, he would later recall, that kept him anchored‚Äîa source of strength in a reality with no clocks, no sunlight, and no certainty of survival.

title: 'No details about incident ': MEA raises Indian student handcuff incident with US
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has taken up the detention of an Indian student in the US with the US embassy, according to sources. This follows an incident at Newark Airport where another Indian student was allegedly handcuffed and deported. The Indian Embassy in Washington DC and the Consulate in New York are seeking details.

title: LA riots: Trump gives 'if I didn't' justification on sending troops
content: Donald Trump claimed his decision to deploy troops in Los Angeles prevented chaos. He criticised California's leadership and permitting delays. Protests erupted over deportation policies. National Guard and Marines were deployed. State officials opposed federal intervention. A lawsuit was filed against the Trump administration. Mayor Karen Bass expressed confusion over the Marines' deployment. Protests continue in other cities as well.

title: 'A very good conversation': Shashi Tharoor on delegation meet with US VP Vance
content: Shashi Tharoor reported on the Indian delegation's "remarkable" meeting with US Vice President JD Vance, strategically positioned between Vance's calls with the Chinese President and German Chancellor. The delegation conveyed concerns and objectives related to India's counter-terrorism stance, receiving positive feedback.

title: Taylor Swift 'feels trapped' in NFL world: Insider says she‚Äôs overwhelmed
content: Insiders reveal that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's romance is facing strain as Kelce's rigorous NFL training clashes with Swift's glamorous lifestyle. Kelce's focus on strict fitness and early nights contrasts with Swift's fast-paced routine, leading to tension. While Swift remains supportive, she misses the spontaneity and fun they once shared as they navigate their demanding careers.

title: 'No travel demand': Airlines ask govt to waive user charges at Srinagar airport
content: Following a significant drop in tourism after the Pahalgam attack, airlines are urging the government to waive airport and security fees for Srinagar flights for a year. This request aims to financially incentivize travel and revive visitor numbers to Kashmir, where hotels and flights are experiencing drastically reduced demand and prices.

title: Austria school shooting: Video shows panic, fear as gunshots echo; 10 killed
content: A tragic school shooting in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of 10 individuals, including the student perpetrator. Authorities suspect the gunman took his own life after the attack at BORG Dreiersch√ºtzengasse school. A disturbing video capturing the sounds of gunfire has surfaced, prompting widespread shock and grief across Europe, with officials expressing condolences and emphasizing the need for school safety.

title: Gauri Khan rents apartment for staff, Sunita Ahuja on reason for fights with Govinda
content: Gauri Khan rents a Mumbai apartment for her staff during Mannat's renovation, while Karan Johar praises the grounded nature of Aryan and Suhana Khan. Sunita Ahuja reveals disagreements with Govinda stem from his career choices. Varun Grover accuses Sandeep Reddy Vanga of obnoxious behavior, and Deepika Padukone launches 75 badminton centers to honor her father's 70th birthday.

title: 'We will go deep into Pak': Jaishankar‚Äôs stern message over terror
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar issued a strong warning to Pakistan, stating India's readiness to conduct strikes within Pakistani territory in response to terrorist provocations. This declaration follows recent Indian military actions, including 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terror camps after a deadly attack in Pahalgam.

title: Woman in black: How elusive Sonam resurfaced in Ghazipur after 16 days
content: Sahil Yadav helped Sonam Raghuvansi, who was distressed, at his dhaba. Sonam had gone missing from Meghalaya. She made a call to her brother. Sahil then called the police. Indore police alerted Ghazipur police. Sonam was taken to a One Stop Center. She was exhausted and slept. Police await Meghalaya team to record her statement.

title: 'Didn't kill my husband': What Sonam told UP cops, what she didn't
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing for over two weeks, was found at a UP dhaba and arrested in connection with her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon. Police allege she plotted the crime with lover Raj Kushwaha. While Sonam denies killing Raja, her silence on key details and missing jewellery deepen suspicion. Both families have demanded a CBI probe.

title: 'Result of Centre's callousness': Mamata blames govt for Pahalgam attack
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticized the Union government's "callousness" regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing the BJP of politicizing the armed forces' valor. She questioned the absence of security personnel at the attack site while praising the forces' bravery during Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Farhan Akhtar got Rs 45 lakh for saying jokes written by me': Varun Grover
content: Varun Grover, the multifaceted screenwriter and comedian, recounted his early career experience on 'Oye! It's Friday!' hosted by Farhan Akhtar, where he noticed a stark pay disparity between writers and actors. Despite writing the material, Grover earned significantly less than Akhtar, leading him to question the value attributed to performers versus writers.

title: At least 10 dead in Austria school shooting, suspect kills self
content: A school shooting in Graz, Austria, at the BORG Dreiersch√ºtzengasse school has resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries. The suspected shooter, believed to be a student, reportedly died by suicide in a school toilet. Police responded swiftly to the scene, with special forces and emergency units deployed, and are currently investigating the incident.

title: Why Forsyth might have been the greatest spy thriller writer of all time
content: The top spot, without contest, belongs to a former Royal Air Force pilot with an eye for detail and a knack for turning geopolitical chaos into page-turning precision: Frederick Forsyth, who departed for Elysium on June 9.

title: 'Eat, sleep, breathe badminton': Deepika's tribute to dad Prakash
content: Deepika Padukone celebrated her father, Prakash Padukone's 70th birthday, by announcing a significant expansion of the Padukone School of Badminton (PSB). The initiative has established over 75 coaching centers across 18 Indian cities, aiming to make badminton accessible to all. ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãRanveer Singh, reacting to the announcement, dropped a heart emoji in the comments section.

title: 'Dhoni bhai ... ': Raina's touching words sends fans into nostalgia
content: Suresh Raina celebrated MS Dhoni's induction into the ICC Hall of Fame, acknowledging his significant impact on cricket. Raina highlighted Dhoni's calm leadership, game-changing contributions, and unwavering commitment as inspirations for millions. Dhoni, now the 11th Indian in the Hall of Fame, is celebrated for his unparalleled leadership and remarkable achievements with the bat and behind the stumps.

title: 'Terrific coach': NFL legend Tom Brady supports Mike Vrabel to lead the Patriots
content: Tom Brady endorses Mike Vrabel as the Patriots' new head coach, citing his leadership and toughness. Vrabel, who replaces Bill Belichick after a transitional season, brings a no-nonsense approach and a proven track record from his time with the Titans. Brady's support fuels hope for a Patriots turnaround, emphasizing Vrabel's ability to instill discipline and resilience.

title: Tragedy strikes Jaipur picnic group: 8 drown in Banas river
content: Eight men from Jaipur drowned in the Banas river in Rajasthan‚Äôs Tonk district on Tuesday. The victims, aged 25-30, were bathing when they accidentally ventured into deep water. Police rescued three survivors who are now stable, but eight were declared dead at the hospital. Authorities are investigating how the group slipped into the deeper part of the river.

title: 'On flight to Sweden': Israel deports Greta after intercepting Gaza-bound ship
content: Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel after being intercepted on a Gaza-bound aid ship. Israeli forces seized the vessel, prompting condemnation from rights groups who cited international law violations. Israel defended its actions, asserting its right to enforce the naval blockade of Gaza, while dismissing the aid mission as a publicity stunt. Former President Trump mocked Thunberg's involvement.

title: 'Peace claims absurd': Cong slams Amit Shah; says BJP diverting attention
content: The Congress party criticizes Amit Shah's claims about peace in Jammu and Kashmir and the Northeast. Jairam Ramesh alleges Shah is diverting attention from failures. He mentions unpunished terrorists in Pahalgam and a poor law and order situation in Manipur. Ramesh accuses Shah of boasting with minimal achievements. Shah had highlighted national security improvements under the Modi government.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' first review: Sudha Murty calls film an 'eye opener'
content: Aamir Khan is returning to the screen with 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The film is a remake of 'Champions'. Sudha Murty praised the movie after a special screening. She highlighted its sensitive portrayal of children with special needs. Murty believes the film promotes inclusivity. 'Sitaare Zameen Par' received a standing ovation. The movie also stars Genelia D'souza.

title: Who is Aleksander Barkov‚Äôs GF? Exploring Florida Panthers star player‚Äôs life
content: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov is currently dating tennis star Marie Bouzkova. The couple made their relationship public in 2024 but maintain a private life. Barkov was seen supporting Bouzkova at Wimbledon. Bouzkova, a Czech tennis player, achieved her first singles title in 2022 at the Prague Open. She holds impressive singles and doubles rankings.

title: 'Will not tolerate illegal entry': US embassy amid Indian student handcuffing row
content: The US embassy in India has firmly stated its stance against illegal immigration, emphasizing that visa abuse and violation of US laws will not be tolerated. This announcement follows an incident at Newark Airport where an Indian student was allegedly handcuffed and deported, sparking outrage.

title: 'Operating with force': Israel issues evacuation warning for parts of Gaza
content: Amid escalating tensions, the Israeli army issued evacuation warnings for northern Gaza areas following a projectile interception. The military declared it would forcefully respond to any terrorist act, urging immediate evacuation south to Gaza City shelters.

title: Did Musk use ketamine, ecstasy drugs? What Trump said
content: Despite a recent public falling out with Elon Musk over tax and spending policies, President Trump stated he intends to continue using Starlink at the White House, praising it as a "good service." This decision comes after Trump hinted at potentially disposing of his Tesla, purchased earlier this year.

title: Delhi police remove former CM Atishi from protest spot, detained
content: AAP leader Atishi was detained by Delhi Police during a protest against planned demolitions at Kalkaji's Bhoomiheen Camp, where residents face eviction notices from the DDA. Atishi accused the BJP of deploying excessive security forces and bulldozing the settlement, primarily inhabited by migrant laborers, despite previous demolitions.

title: Greenland rejected for Concacaf membership

title: The field of 8 is set: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the field for the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska, is set . it'll be the Racers' first time in Omaha . four teams are making their first appearances in Omaha since winning the title the last time they made it this far .

title: U.S. Open tiers: Ranking every player in the field at Oakmont

title: Where Connor McDavid, Leon Draisaitl rank as an all-time playoff duo
content: Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl are the two highest-scoring players in Stanley Cup playoffs history . he is second (295 points in 236 games) to Gretzky (382 points in 208 games) in all-time postseason scoring .

title: Overhead at the NHL draft combine: Draft wild cards, surprises ... and the X factor team
content: scouts and executives alike marveled at what could be an unpredictable first round . the upcoming draft is expected to be announced on july 27 and 28 . "there are maybe 16 or 18 players I could see going in the top 10," says one .
